channel.title: Black screen!?
channel.description: when i try to open the game i get a black screen only..same thing with webclient...any1 know how to fix it? things that didnt: updating java, clearing cache, restating comp, bad comp (cuz its not) trying to download ( works but click twice and it closes ). so anything other than that would help me fix and let me play would be nice =).

item.title: Black screen!?
item.dc:creator: @rain1994 rain1994
item.description:
@rain1994 wrote:

I had the same problem like 2 days ago I deleated my java reinstalled it. My problem was fixed then.

Read full topic

item.title: Black screen!?
item.dc:creator: @The_Reaper_X The Reaper X
item.description:
@The_Reaper_X wrote:

[quote=“pure2ownage, post:12, topic:349119”][quote author=The Reaper X link=topic=445492.msg3271232#msg3271232 date=1279219728]

[quote author=ziplock link=topic=445492.msg3271231#msg3271231 date=1279219638]

You need a 16 gig ram and a 2gig graphics card to run rspservers, sorry :(.

The hell? I have 4gig ram and 256mb graphics card and I can run them perfectly fine.
[/quote]I have 256MB of RAM. I cba to check my graphics card knowing that.
[/quote]A Regular Java RSPS Client uses around 25-40k RAM[/quote]Woops, my bad. My mom thought it would be nice to get an addition so I would stop complaining about how slow the computer was. She bought 128mb of RAM last year…

Read full topic

item.title: Black screen!?
item.dc:creator: @The_Reaper_X The Reaper X
item.description:
@The_Reaper_X wrote:

Running a server source version (317, 474, 508, etc.) that isn’t compatible with the server client will often times give you this result.

Read full topic

item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

cahhillbuddy:

since im on mac, and it has its own java, do u know how i would go about the tranfer to 32 bit? or should i start going google crazy?

That I’m not sure, but if you are talking about a RSPS, then you could look at this.

moparisthebest.com

item.title: Black screen!?
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

cahhillbuddy:

yes to the 64 bit, and rsps? idk wut that is… but if u tell me ill find it =)

Uninstall your current 64bit java, and install 32bit java. I know it sounds fishy, but that is what fixed it for others.

Read full topic
